channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: What a MESS: Multi-Domain Evaluation of Zero-Shot Semantic Segmentation
item.description: To address this problem, zero-shot semantic segmentation makes use of large self-supervised vision-language models, allowing zero-shot transfer to unseen classes.

item.title: ShuttleSet22: Benchmarking Stroke Forecasting with Stroke-Level Badminton Dataset
item.description: We also hold a challenge, Track 2: Forecasting Future Turn-Based Strokes in Badminton Rallies, at CoachAI Badminton Challenge 2023 to boost researchers to tackle this problem.

item.title: Simulating counterfactuals
item.description: Counterfactual inference considers a hypothetical intervention in a parallel world that shares some evidence with the factual world.

item.title: SSC-RS: Elevate LiDAR Semantic Scene Completion with Representation Separation and BEV Fusion
item.description: However, how to effectively exploit the relationships between the semantic context in semantic segmentation and geometric structure in scene completion remains under exploration.

item.title: Transferability Metrics for Object Detection
item.description: In our experiments, we compare TLogME to state-of-the-art metrics in the estimation of transfer performance of the Faster-RCNN object detector.

item.title: Exploiting Pseudo Future Contexts for Emotion Recognition in Conversations
item.description: Specifically, for an utterance, we generate its future context with pre-trained language models, potentially containing extra beneficial knowledge in a conversational form homogeneous with the historical ones.

item.title: Automatic Annotation of Direct Speech in Written French Narratives
item.description: The automatic annotation of direct speech (AADS) in written text has been often used in computational narrative understanding.

item.title: IDOL: Indicator-oriented Logic Pre-training for Logical Reasoning
item.description: IDOL achieves state-of-the-art performance on ReClor and LogiQA, the two most representative benchmarks in logical reasoning MRC, and is proven to be capable of generalizing to different pre-trained models and other types of MRC benchmarks like RACE and SQuAD 2. 0 while keeping competitive general language understanding ability through testing on tasks in GLUE.

item.title: One-class systems seamlessly fit in the forward-forward algorithm
item.description: The forward-forward algorithm presents a new method of training neural networks by updating weights during an inference, performing parameter updates for each layer individually.

item.title: Symphonize 3D Semantic Scene Completion with Contextual Instance Queries
item.description: By incorporating the queries as the instance feature representations within the scene, Symphonies dynamically encodes the instance-centric semantics to interact with the image and volume features while avoiding the dense voxel-wise modeling.

item.title: PyBADS: Fast and robust black-box optimization in Python
item.description: PyBADS is a Python implementation of the Bayesian Adaptive Direct Search (BADS) algorithm for fast and robust black-box optimization (Acerbi and Ma 2017).

item.title: Automatic Truss Design with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Directly applying end-to-end reinforcement learning (RL) methods to truss layout design is infeasible either, since only a tiny portion of the entire layout space is valid under the physical constraints, leading to particularly sparse rewards for RL training.

item.title: CellViT: Vision Transformers for Precise Cell Segmentation and Classification
item.description: Nuclei detection and segmentation in hematoxylin and eosin-stained (H&E) tissue images are important clinical tasks and crucial for a wide range of applications.

item.title: A Meta-analytical Comparison of Naive Bayes and Random Forest for Software Defect Prediction
item.description: We conducted a systematic literature review by establishing criteria to search and choose papers, resulting in five studies.

item.title: Understanding Client Reactions in Online Mental Health Counseling
item.description: Communication success relies heavily on reading participants' reactions.

item.title: DCID: Deep Canonical Information Decomposition
item.description: Canonical Correlation Analysis (CCA)-based methods have traditionally been used to identify shared variables, however, they were designed for multivariate targets and only offer trivial solutions for univariate cases.

item.title: Exploiting Inferential Structure in Neural Processes
item.description: Neural Processes (NPs) are appealing due to their ability to perform fast adaptation based on a context set.

item.title: KnowPrefix-Tuning: A Two-Stage Prefix-Tuning Framework for Knowledge-Grounded Dialogue Generation
item.description: We propose Knowledgeable Prefix Tuning (KnowPrefix-Tuning), a two-stage tuning framework, bypassing the retrieval process in a knowledge-grounded conversation system by injecting prior knowledge into the lightweight knowledge prefix.

item.title: LeanDojo: Theorem Proving with Retrieval-Augmented Language Models
item.description: Using this data, we develop ReProver (Retrieval-Augmented Prover): the first LLM-based prover that is augmented with retrieval for selecting premises from a vast math library.

item.title: You Can Mask More For Extremely Low-Bitrate Image Compression
item.description: Extensive experiments have demonstrated that our approach outperforms recent state-of-the-art methods in R-D performance, visual quality, and downstream applications, at very low bitrates.

item.title: CLIPA-v2: Scaling CLIP Training with 81.1% Zero-shot ImageNet Accuracy within a \$10,000 Budget; An Extra \$4,000 Unlocks 81.8% Accuracy
item.description: The recent work CLIPA presents an inverse scaling law for CLIP training -- whereby the larger the image/text encoders used, the shorter the sequence length of image/text tokens that can be applied in training.

item.title: Shikra: Unleashing Multimodal LLM's Referential Dialogue Magic
item.description: Referential dialogue is a superset of various vision-language (VL) tasks.

item.title: PANet: LiDAR Panoptic Segmentation with Sparse Instance Proposal and Aggregation
item.description: Firstly, we propose a non-learning Sparse Instance Proposal (SIP) module with the ``sampling-shifting-grouping" scheme to directly group thing points into instances from the raw point cloud efficiently.

item.title: MIMIC: Masked Image Modeling with Image Correspondences
item.description: Unfortunately, the effective pretraining datasets are those with multi-view scenes and have only been curated using annotated 3D meshes, point clouds, and camera parameters from simulated environments.

item.title: Adaptive Annealed Importance Sampling with Constant Rate Progress
item.description: This algorithm relies on a sequence of interpolating distributions bridging the target to an initial tractable distribution such as the well-known geometric mean path of unnormalized distributions which is assumed to be suboptimal in general.

item.title: [Re] Double Sampling Randomized Smoothing
item.description: This paper is a contribution to the reproducibility challenge in the field of machine learning, specifically addressing the issue of certifying the robustness of neural networks (NNs) against adversarial perturbations.

item.title: Anomaly Detection in Networks via Score-Based Generative Models
item.description: Node outlier detection in attributed graphs is a challenging problem for which there is no method that would work well across different datasets.

item.title: Quality Issues in Machine Learning Software Systems
item.description: We validate the identified quality issues via a survey with ML practitioners.

item.title: On-Device Evaluation Toolkit for Machine Learning on Heterogeneous Low-Power System-on-Chip
item.description: We provide an open source implementation of U-TOE and we demonstrate its use to experimentally evaluate the performance of a wide variety of models, on a wide variety of low-power boards, based on popular microcontroller architectures (ARM Cortex-M and RISC-V).

item.title: Faithful Synthesis of Low-dose Contrast-enhanced Brain MRI Scans using Noise-preserving Conditional GANs
item.description: Our numerical experiments show that conditional GANs are suitable for generating images at different GBCA dose levels and can be used to augment datasets for virtual contrast models.

item.title: SugarCrepe: Fixing Hackable Benchmarks for Vision-Language Compositionality
item.description: In the last year alone, a surge of new benchmarks to measure compositional understanding of vision-language models have permeated the machine learning ecosystem.

item.title: WinoQueer: A Community-in-the-Loop Benchmark for Anti-LGBTQ+ Bias in Large Language Models
item.description: We present WinoQueer: a benchmark specifically designed to measure whether large language models (LLMs) encode biases that are harmful to the LGBTQ+ community.

item.title: AME-CAM: Attentive Multiple-Exit CAM for Weakly Supervised Segmentation on MRI Brain Tumor
item.description: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is commonly used for brain tumor segmentation, which is critical for patient evaluation and treatment planning.

item.title: Beyond AUROC & co. for evaluating out-of-distribution detection performance
item.description: While there has been a growing research interest in developing out-of-distribution (OOD) detection methods, there has been comparably little discussion around how these methods should be evaluated.

item.title: LongCoder: A Long-Range Pre-trained Language Model for Code Completion
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a new task for code completion that focuses on handling long code input and propose a sparse Transformer model, called LongCoder, to address this task.

item.title: MedLSAM: Localize and Segment Anything Model for 3D Medical Images
item.description: Nevertheless, both the original SAM and its medical adaptations necessitate slice-by-slice annotations, which directly increase the annotation workload with the size of the dataset.

item.title: TransERR: Translation-based Knowledge Graph Completion via Efficient Relation Rotation
item.description: This paper presents translation-based knowledge graph completion method via efficient relation rotation (TransERR), a straightforward yet effective alternative to traditional translation-based knowledge graph completion models.

item.title: Medical Federated Model with Mixture of Personalized and Sharing Components
item.description: Comparing with 13 existing related methods, the proposed method successfully achieves the best model performance, and meanwhile up to 60% improvement of communication efficiency.

item.title: Off-Policy Evaluation of Ranking Policies under Diverse User Behavior
item.description: We show that the resulting estimator, which we call Adaptive IPS (AIPS), can be unbiased under any complex user behavior.

item.title: Data-Driven Chance-Constrained Multiple-Choice Knapsack Problem: Model, Algorithms, and Applications
item.description: We first present the problem formulation of DDCCMCKP, and then establish two benchmark sets.

item.title: PTVD: A Large-Scale Plot-Oriented Multimodal Dataset Based on Television Dramas
item.description: Art forms such as movies and television (TV) dramas are reflections of the real world, which have attracted much attention from the multimodal learning community recently.

item.title: Fauno: The Italian Large Language Model that will leave you senza parole!
item.description: This paper presents Fauno, the first and largest open-source Italian conversational Large Language Model (LLM).

item.title: A Solution to CVPR'2023 AQTC Challenge: Video Alignment for Multi-Step Inference
item.description: In this paper, we present a solution for enhancing video alignment to improve multi-step inference.

item.title: logLTN: Differentiable Fuzzy Logic in the Logarithm Space
item.description: A significant trend in the literature involves integrating axioms and facts in loss functions by grounding logical symbols with neural networks and operators with fuzzy semantics.

item.title: Beyond dynamic programming
item.description: We demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach by applying it to nonlinear optimal control problems.

item.title: Statistical Component Separation for Targeted Signal Recovery in Noisy Mixtures
item.description: In the case of 1), we show that our method better recovers the descriptors of the target data than a standard denoising method in most situations.

item.title: Structured Dialogue Discourse Parsing
item.description: In addition, unlike in previous work, we do not rely on hand-crafted features; this improves the model's robustness.

item.title: Aligning Large Multi-Modal Model with Robust Instruction Tuning
item.description: Our dataset consists of 120k visual instructions generated by GPT4, covering 16 vision-and-language tasks with open-ended instructions and answers.

item.title: DNABERT-2: Efficient Foundation Model and Benchmark For Multi-Species Genome
item.description: Decoding the linguistic intricacies of the genome is a crucial problem in biology, and pre-trained foundational models such as DNABERT and Nucleotide Transformer have made significant strides in this area.

item.title: Design from Policies: Conservative Test-Time Adaptation for Offline Policy Optimization
item.description: Naturally, such a paradigm raises three core questions that are \textit{not} fully answered by prior non-iterative offline RL counterparts like reward-conditioned policy: Q1) What information should we transfer from the inner-level to the outer-level?
